today I'm going to be making the recipe

you
you
this is just a quick easy and extremely

eggs a spoonful of minced pork a squirt
of soy sauce some oil and you're good to
go so you could also use a frying pan or
a wok which is very common but if you
want to make an authentic Thai Chi GL
you got to use a little pot like this
that way the omelette can sort of fill
up the hole the whole pan and be a nice
circular shape now in order to make an
authentic Thai Street food omelette
you've got to use a lot of oil and I'm
talking like half a cup here so once
your oil is heating start by cracking
two eggs into a bowl then adding one
over heaping tablespoonful of minced
pork or whatever minced meat of your
choice into the bowl
next you can break those yolks and give
it a quick whisk with a fork at about
three-quarters of a tablespoon of soy
sauce and then really start to whisk up
your egg using deep circular motions
this is going to add some air to the
omelette so it puffs up and is nice and
fluffy when you cook it okay make sure
your oil is hot and keep on stirring all
the way until you pour it in oh yeah and
that is exactly what you're looking for
it's sort of pillow up you just want to
make sure you put it only one time if

take about 30 seconds or so before your
omelette is nice and golden brown on the

flipping keep cooking it for about
another 30 seconds or so pressing it
down with your spatula to make sure it's
cooked all the way through and then take

what we're looking for right there a
